group: DUKE ELLINGTON AND HIS COTTON CLUB ORCHESTRA

entries.value: Arthur Whetsel, Freddie Jenkins(t); Cootie Williams(t,v); Joe Nanton(tb); Barney Bigard(cl,ts); Johnny Hodges(as); Harry Carney(as,ts,bar); Duke Ellington(p); Fred Guy(bj); Wellman Braud(sb); Sonny Greer(d,v).

entries.content: The tenor sax solo at the start of "Hot Feet" is the only Carney recording on that instrument. New DESOR, shows "Dicty Glide" take 1 on some copies of Vi V-38053 and "Sloppy Joe" take 1 on some copies of Vi V-38065, but Steven Lasker believes the New DESOR is mistaken on these points, since in over 45 years of collecting Ellington’s records, he’s never encountered either take on an issued Victor 78.

description: RKO "Black and Tan" film recording session, Gramercy Studios

entries.value: Arthur Whetsel, Cootie Williams, Freddie Jenkins(t); Joe Nanton(tb); Juan Tizol(vtb); Barney Bigard(cl,ts); Johnny Hodges(ss,as); Harry Carney(as,bar); Duke Ellington(p); Fred Guy(bj); Wellman Braud(sb); Sonny Greer(d); Choir(v).

entries.content: Same Train is by Choir only. Although several reference works identify the choir as the Hall Johnson Choir, Steven Lasker has found no credible evidence that the Hall Johnson Choir worked on ‘Black and Tan’.
